      • getBetterLocation

        public static Location getBetterLocation(Location newLocation,
                         Location currentBestLocation)
        Determines whether one android.location.Location reading is better than the current android.location.Location fix.

        Code taken from Android developer guides. Linked in "see also".
        If you wish to change the amount of time (in milliseconds) this method uses to judge if a locations timestamp is "significantly newer" or "significantly older", you may do so through
        Parameters:
        newLocation - The new android.location.Location that you want to evaluate
        currentBestLocation - The current android.location.Location fix, to which you want to compare the new one
        Returns:
        The better android.location.Location object based on recency and accuracy. setYoungLocationAgeLimit(long).
        See Also:
        http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/location/obtaining-user-location.html

      • getLastLocation

        public static Location getLastLocation()
        Gets the last best known location from the Android LocationManager. If both network and gps location providers are enabled, it will compare the two Location's using {
        Returns:
        the last known location, or default location if set. getBetterLocation(Location, android.location.Location) before returning a result.

        Returns:
        the last known location, or default location if set.

      • getStepInterval

        public static long getStepInterval()
        Gets the step interval.

        This value determines the length of time each step should be.

        Default of 5000 milliseconds, minimum of 100 milliseconds.
        Returns:
        the step interval

      • getYoungLocationAgeLimit

        public static long getYoungLocationAgeLimit()
        Gets the young location age limit.

        This value is used in judging if a android.location.Location's timestamp is "significantly older" or "significantly newer" than another, in
        Returns:
        the young location age limit getBetterLocation(Location, android.location.Location) .

        Default of 2 minutes (120000 milliseconds), minimum of 1 millisecond.

      • requestUpdatesFromBothProviders

        public static Location requestUpdatesFromBothProviders(LocationListener gpsListener,
                                       LocationListener wifiListener)
        Request updates from both providers. Requests updates from both
        Parameters:
        gpsListener - the gps listener to pass along to LocationManager for various updates, specifically from GPS.
        wifiListener - the wifi listener to pass along to LocationManager for various updates, specifically from network.
        Returns:
        the last location known location, or default location if set. LocationManager.GPS_PROVIDER and LocationManager.NETWORK_PROVIDER location service providers.

      • requestUpdatesFromProvider

        public static Location requestUpdatesFromProvider(String provider,
                                  LocationListener listener)
        Request updates from provider a certain provider.
        Parameters:
        provider - the provider to start getting updates from. See LocationManager's static public fields for options.
        listener - the listener to pass along to the LocationManager when requesting location updates.
        Returns:
        the last known location

      • setDefaultLocation

        public static void setDefaultLocation(Double latitude,
                      Double longitude)
        Sets the default location by latitude and longitude values. Sets the default location. This is used if not null, and if you'd like a default value to use if a location can not be determined by the device. If both latitude and longitude are null, it will also nullify the default location value.
        Parameters:
        latitude - the latitude
        longitude - the longitude

      • setDefaultLocation

        public static void setDefaultLocation(Location location)
        Sets the default location by android.location.Location. This is used if not null, and if you'd like a default value to use if a location can not be determined by the device.
        Parameters:
        location - the new default location

      • setLocationManager

        public static void setLocationManager(LocationManager locationManager)
        Sets the location manager.
        Parameters:
        locationManager - the new location manager

      • setStepInterval

        public static void setStepInterval(long stepInterval)
        Sets the step time interval.

        This value determines the length of time each step should be but also dictates the minimum update for LocationManager.

        Default of 5000 milliseconds, minimum of 100 milliseconds. This default value will be heavy on battery and is only recommended for when precision and fast location updates are needed.
        Parameters:
        stepInterval - the stepInterval to set

      • setYoungLocationAgeLimit

        public static void setYoungLocationAgeLimit(long youngLocationAgeLimit)
        Sets the young location age limit.

        This value is used in judging if a android.location.Location's timestamp is "significantly older" or "significantly newer" than another, in
        Parameters:
        youngLocationAgeLimit - the youngLocationAgeLimit to set getBetterLocation(Location, android.location.Location) .

        Default of 2 minutes (120000 milliseconds), minimum of 1 millisecond.
